body: ### What Feature / Enhancement? Somehow the search engine does not list this app on the Homey page. Right now I was able to (re)install it because I had it saved in my bookmarks. ### Why is this useful? The standard method as listed in the Installation / From Homey App Store section: add app --> search --> install is not working, it would help other users to find this app on the site. ### How would it work? (optional idea) _No response_ ### Category Documentation ### Examples / References _No response_ ### Checklist - [x] I have searched existing issues (no duplicate) - [x] This feature is relevant to local Zigbee control
title: [Feature] Add direct link to README.md

[Device] Zigbee IR remote controle (ZS06)

### Feature Type

Other

### Problem Statement

Added Capability `thermostat_programming`
Added Capability `window_open`

    at App._validate (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/homey/lib/App.js:133:13)
    at async App.install (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/homey/lib/App.js:812:19)
    at async App.runRemote (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/homey/lib/App.js:202:21)
    at async exports.handler (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/homey/bin/cmds/app/run.js:48:5)

### Proposed Solution

not sure, tried to delete things, didn't work

### Alternatives Considered

_No response_

_No response_

body: ## üì± Basic Information **Brand & Model**: 2 Gang dimmer module, Moes **Purchase Link**: https://moeshouse.com/products/zigbee-dimmer-module?variant=39820565807185 **Power Source**: Mains **Current Status**: Not working at all --- ## üîç Zigbee Fingerprint (MANDATORY) Please provide this information from Homey Developer Tools: **Manufacturer Name**: `_TZE200_e3oitdyu` **Model ID**: `TS0601` **Endpoints**: `[incorrect]` **Clusters**: `[ - ]` ### How to Get Fingerprint: 1. Pair device with Homey 2. Go to Developer Tools ‚Üí Devices ‚Üí [Your Device] 3. Click "Advanced" tab 4. Screenshot OR copy the information above **Screenshot or fingerprint data**: --- ## üîó References https://github.com/Koenkk/zigbee2mqtt/issues/10892 --- ## ‚ú® Expected Capabilities What features should work? Check all that apply: - [x] On/Off - [x] Brightness/Dim - [x] Energy monitoring (power, current, voltage) - [x] Other: Check additional notes --- ## üìù Additional Notes Any other relevant information (e.g., specific modes, known issues, etc.) When pairing the 2-gang dimmer module, an incorrect driver is assigned to the device. Until last week, the ceiling-fan driver was being applied. After the recent update, Homey now recognises the device as a climate sensor and assigns the corresponding driver instead. However, as far as I understand, this is the driver that should be assigned: https://github.com/dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee/tree/master/drivers/dimmer_dual_channel For further questions, feel free to reach out!
title: Bug - Incorrect driver assigned to device - 2 gang dimmer module x climate sensor
Device Request - Presence Sensor Radar - _TZE204_mtoaryre / TS0601

body:
Hi!
I see that support for my device was added in commit https://github.com/dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee/commit/9a6564b4bfd8f5caa5af81abadfbc7415a6594b0 (TS0501B / _TZB210_ngnt8kni). Thank you!

However, after updating, removing the old device and re-pairing, Homey adds it as ‚ÄúSmart Bulb Dimmer‚Äù instead of the new Dimmable LED Driver profile. (Led controller cct) This device is not a bulb, it is a 24V LED strip driver (LED controller CCT). Thanks again for the quick implementation

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fb6036e9-7a21-43d3-a810-5f8d3c901dd5)
title: WoodUpp / Tuya 24V LED Driver

body: ## üì± Basic Information **Brand & Model**: WoodUpp / Tuya 24V LED Driver **Purchase Link**: https://woodupp.no/produkt/led/?attribute_pa_led_qty=pakke-med-5-led **Power Source**: [ ] Battery / [x] Mains **Current Status**: [ ] Not pairing / [x] Pairs but missing features / [ ] Not working at all --- ## üîç Zigbee Fingerprint (MANDATORY) Please provide this information from Homey Developer Tools: Manufacturer: _TZB210_ngnt8kni Product ID (Model): TS0501B Device Type: router Firmware: - Capabilities missing: dim Currently added as: Unknown Zigbee Device ### How to Get Fingerprint: 1. Pair device with Homey 2. Go to Developer Tools ‚Üí Devices ‚Üí [Your Device] 3. Click "Advanced" tab 4. Screenshot OR copy the information above **Screenshot or fingerprint data**: ``` Paste fingerprint here ``` --- ## üìä TS0601 Data Points (if applicable) Not applicable ‚Äî device is NOT TS0601/DATA-POINT based. It is a standard Tuya LED Dimmer (TS0501B). --- ## üîó References **Zigbee2MQTT**: (link if exists) **Home Assistant/ZHA**: (link if exists) **Other documentation**: (any other helpful links) Device page for TS0501B: https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/supported-devices/#tuya_ts0501b --- ## ‚ú® Expected Capabilities What features should work? Check all that apply: - [x] On/Off - [x] Brightness/Dim - [ ] Temperature - [ ] Humidity - [ ] Motion detection - [ ] Contact sensor - [ ] Battery level - [ ] Energy monitoring (power, current, voltage) - [ ] Other: _________ --- ## üìù Additional Notes ‚Ä¢ The device pairs with Homey Pro but is added as Unknown Zigbee Device ‚Ä¢ Dimming is not exposed ‚Ä¢ This device should be handled as a Tuya ‚ÄúTS0501B Dimmer‚Äù ‚Ä¢ Please add fingerprint to Tuya Zigbee app so it binds On/Off (0x0006) and Level Control (0x0008)
title: Add support for TS0501B / _TZB210_ngnt8kni (Tuya 24V LED Driver)
Tuya Zigbee Temperature Humidity Sensor with LCD Screen ZTH05Z

body:
## Basic Info
- **Brand**: Tuya
- **Model** (printed on label): TS0601 ZTH02 v1.0
- **Manufacturer Name** (from Homey dev tools): _TZE200_9yapgbuv
- **Model ID** (e.g., TS0601, TS0011, TS011F): TS0601

## Evidence

This device is currently registered as a "sound controller", but this is a temperature/humidity sensor.

Original upstream issue for implementation with all necessary details: 
https://github.com/JohanBendz/com.tuya.zigbee/issues/850
title: [DEVICE] TS0601_TZE200_9yapgbuv incorrectly defined as sound controller

body:
üì± Basic Information

Brand & Model: Avatto TRV06 Zigbee Radiator Thermostat Valve
Purchase Link: [Aliexpress](https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/1005008158452301.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.35.230779d2FZPLZE&gatewayAdapt=glo2nld)
Power Source: ‚òë Battery
Current Status: ‚òë Pairs but missing features
(Added as ‚ÄúUnknown Zigbee Device‚Äù in Homey)

üîç Zigbee Fingerprint (MANDATORY)

Manufacturer Name: _TZE200_hvaxb2tc
Model ID: TS0601
Endpoints: (as detected by Homey ‚Äì included in diagnostics report below)
Clusters: (from diagnostics report)

How to Get Fingerprint:

Already paired ‚Äì data included below.

Screenshot or fingerprint data:

Manufacturer: _TZE200_hvaxb2tc
Model: TS0601
Device: Radiator TRV
Brand: Avatto
Model: TRV06
Identifies as: TS0601 Tuya thermostat
Device added as: Unknown Zigbee Device in Homey

üìä TS0601 Data Points (if applicable)

Device uses the common Tuya TS0601 data point structure.

(Exact DP mapping depends on firmware, but typical TRV mappings expected are:)

DP ID | Function | Example Value | Read/Write -- | -- | -- | -- 1 | Target temperature setpoint | 200 (20.0¬∞C) | RW 2 | Heating mode / system run state | 0/1 | R 3 | Schedule mode | 0/1 | RW 4 | Battery (%) | 87 | R 16 | Valve opening position | 0‚Äì100 | R 20 | Child lock | 0/1 | RW

If the developer needs the exact values, they can be extracted from the full diagnostics report.

üîó References

Zigbee2MQTT (same hardware family):
https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/devices/TS0601_thermostat.html

Home Assistant / ZHA reference:
https://github.com/zigpy/zha-device-handlers/issues?q=TS0601

No official Avatto documentation found beyond sales listing.

‚ú® Expected Capabilities

Please add support for the following TRV features:

  • On/Off

  • Temperature (read)

  • Target temperature (write/setpoint)

  • Battery level

  • Valve position

  • Child lock

  • Window detection (if exposed by firmware)

Additional TRV features commonly available on this model:

  • Schedule mode

  • Boost mode

  • Manual/Auto modes

üìù Additional Notes

  • Device pairs successfully via Universal Tuya Zigbee but is identified as Unknown Zigbee Device because the fingerprint _TZE200_hvaxb2tc is not yet included in the TS0601 TRV driver.

  • Adding this fingerprint to the TS0601 thermostat mapping should resolve full functionality.

  • Many similar Avatto TRV models work once their _TZE200_‚Ä¶ variant is added.
title: [DEVICE] Thermostat Radiator Valve

body:
### Feature Type

New capability (e.g., color control, scenes)

### Problem Statement

Hi @dlnraja, I appreciate your effort to pick up and improve the com.tuya.zigbee application. I noticed my PRs don't get merged and the project has not been updated for a while and found this as an alternative. I'd like to see if I can help out a little.

I found a bug which causes me to not be able to open configuration in settings. I have fixed this issue along with other things. Unfortunately I am restricted to create a pull request. Could you give public access to it?

### Proposed Solution

See message above.

### Alternatives Considered

_No response_

### Examples

_No response_

### Priority (Your Opinion)

Critical - Blocking my use case

### Affected Devices

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

### Checklist

- [x] I have searched for similar feature requests
- [x] This feature aligns with local Zigbee control
- [x] I'm willing to help test this feature
- [ ] I can provide technical details if needed
title: [Feature] Making pull requests public

body:
### D√©crire le bug
Lors de l'ex√©cution de `git push`, l'op√©ration est rejet√©e avec le message d'erreur :
`! [rejected]        master -> master (fetch first)`
`error: failed to push some refs to 'https://github.com/dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee.git'`

### Reproduire le bug
1. Avoir des commits locaux sur la branche `master`.
2. Avoir un commit sur la branche `master` distante (sur GitHub) qui n'est pas pr√©sent localement.
3. Ex√©cuter `git push origin master`.

### Comportement attendu
Le push devrait r√©ussir, mais il est bloqu√© par s√©curit√© car les historiques ont diverg√©.

### Contexte additionnel
Ce probl√®me est survenu car le fichier `automation.yml` a √©t√© modifi√© directement sur l'interface web de GitHub, tandis que du code pour des appareils (boutons 3 et 4 gangs) a √©t√© commit√© localement.

La solution consiste √† synchroniser les changements distants avant de pousser, en utilisant `git pull --rebase` pour maintenir un historique propre et lin√©aire.
title: [FIX] R√©soudre le rejet du push (rejected master -> master)

body:
### Description de la T√¢che
L'utilisateur @dlnraja a d√©velopp√© du code pour la prise en charge de nouveaux appareils :
- Boutons 3 gangs
- Lumi√®re (light) 4 gangs

Ces modifications ont √©t√© faites localement et pouss√©es via plusieurs "push", mais elles ne semblent pas √™tre pr√©sentes sur la branche `master` du d√©p√¥t `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee`.

### Objectif
S'assurer que toutes les modifications de code locales de l'utilisateur sont correctement commit√©es et pouss√©es vers la branche `master` du d√©p√¥t sur GitHub.

### √âtapes √† suivre (pour @dlnraja)
Pour synchroniser votre code local avec le d√©p√¥t GitHub, veuillez ex√©cuter les commandes suivantes dans votre terminal PowerShell sur votre ordinateur :

1.  **Se placer dans le bon dossier :**
    ```powershell
    cd C:\Users\HP\Desktop\com.tuya.zigbee
    ```

2.  **V√©rifier la branche actuelle :**
    ```powershell
    git branch
    ```
    *(Assurez-vous que l'√©toile `*` est bien √† c√¥t√© de `master`)*

3.  **Ajouter tous vos fichiers modifi√©s :**
    ```powershell
    git add .
    ```

4.  **Cr√©er un "commit" qui sauvegarde vos changements :**
    ```powershell
    git commit -m "feat: Add support for 3-gang and 4-gang devices"
    ```
    *(Si vous avez un message d'erreur disant "nothing to commit", passez √† l'√©tape suivante).*

5.  **Pousser vos changements vers GitHub :**
    ```powershell
    git push origin master
    ```

Une fois ces commandes ex√©cut√©es, votre code sera √† jour sur GitHub.
title: Int√©grer les √©volutions de code pour les boutons 3 et 4 gangs

body:
### Describe the bug

> Le workflow `Automated Tuya Zigbee Contributions` √©choue syst√©matiquement √† l'√©tape `actions/checkout@v4` avec l'erreur : `Error: Input required and not supplied: token`.

Ce probl√®me persiste malgr√© les tentatives de correction suivantes :
1.  Ajout de la section `permissions` avec les droits `contents: write` et `pull-requests: write` dans le fichier `automation.yml`.
2.  Configuration des param√®tres du d√©p√¥t (`Settings > Actions > General`) pour accorder les permissions de "Lecture et √©criture" aux workflows.

### To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Aller √† l'onglet 'Actions'.
2. S√©lectionner le workflow 'Automated Tuya Zigbee Contributions'.
3. Lancer le workflow manuellement via 'Run workflow'.
4. Observer l'√©chec √† l'√©tape 'Run actions/checkout@v4'.

### Expected behavior

> Le workflow devrait s'ex√©cuter avec succ√®s, en particulier l'√©tape de `checkout`, car les permissions ont √©t√© configur√©es.

### App and Homey version

> * What Homey version are you running?
> * What version of Homey firmware do you use?
> * What version of the Tuya Zigbee App are you using?

### Screenshots

> L'erreur est visible dans les logs du workflow : `Error: Input required and not supplied: token`

### Additional context

> **Hypoth√®se :** L'erreur est tr√®s probablement due aux restrictions de s√©curit√© que GitHub impose aux workflows s'ex√©cutant sur des d√©p√¥ts clon√©s (forks). Par d√©faut, le `GITHUB_TOKEN` a des permissions restreintes en lecture seule, ce qui n√©cessite une approbation manuelle pour √©lever les privil√®ges.
> 
> **Contexte de la session :**
> - **Utilisateur :** dlnraja
> - **Date de l'erreur :** 2025-07-20 15:54:29 UTC
title: [BUG] Le workflow √©choue √† l'√©tape de checkout avec une erreur de token li√©e aux permissions du fork

body:
### Describe the bug
L'automatisation des contributions sur le fork `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee` √©choue syst√©matiquement √† cause d'un historique Git conflictuel. Les tentatives de synchronisation, de nettoyage de branche, ou de push forc√© se soldent par des erreurs persistantes, rendant le workflow inop√©rant. Le probl√®me est si profond√©ment ancr√© que seule une r√©initialisation compl√®te du d√©p√¥t (suppression et nouveau fork) a permis de le contourner.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Utiliser le fork initial de `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee`.
2. Tenter de mettre en place un script (PowerShell ou via GitHub Actions) pour synchroniser la branche avec `upstream/master`.
3. Essayer de r√©soudre les conflits ou de forcer un push.
4. Constater les erreurs telles que `! [remote rejected]` ou des √©checs de rebase infinis.

### Expected behavior
Le workflow d'automatisation devrait pouvoir se synchroniser avec le d√©p√¥t `upstream`, appliquer les modifications de code et de documentation, et pousser les commits vers le fork `origin` sans √™tre bloqu√© par des conflits historiques insolubles.

### Screenshots
Les logs des terminaux PowerShell partag√©s dans la conversation illustrent les diff√©rentes erreurs rencontr√©es.

### Additional context
Le probl√®me a √©t√© r√©solu en supprimant compl√®tement le fork `dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee` et en en cr√©ant un nouveau, vierge de tout historique conflictuel. La nouvelle configuration, bas√©e sur ce d√©p√¥t propre, est maintenant fonctionnelle. Cette issue documente le "bug" initial pour m√©moire.
title: Bug: √âchec de l'automatisation √† cause d'un historique Git conflictuel insoluble
